definition: causing to move repeatedly from side to side, move with or as if with a tremor
details:
noun
- causing to move repeatedly from side to side
= synonyms: wag
- a reflex motion caused by cold or fear or excitement
= synonyms: tremble, shiver
- grasping and shaking a person's hand (as to acknowledge an introduction or to agree on a contract)
= synonyms: handshake, handshaking, handclasp
- a note that alternates rapidly with another note a semitone above it
= synonyms: trill
- frothy drink of milk and flavoring and sometimes fruit or ice cream
= synonyms: milkshake, milk shake
- building material used as siding or roofing
= synonyms: shingle
verb
- move with or as if with a tremor
= synonyms: didder
- undermine or cause to waver
= example: undermine or cause to waver
- bring to a specified condition by or as if by shaking
= example: bring to a specified condition by or as if by shaking
- shake (a body part) to communicate a greeting, feeling, or cognitive state
= example: shake (a body part) to communicate a greeting, feeling, or cognitive state
- stir the feelings, emotions, or peace of
= synonyms: stir, stimulate, excite, shake up
- move back and forth or sideways
= synonyms: rock, sway
- move or cause to move back and forth
- shake or vibrate rapidly and intensively
= synonyms: judder
- get rid of
= example: get rid of
= synonyms: throw
